data.title: Harry Nilsson: Best Friend / Girlfriend
data.meta_description: Back in 1968, Harry Nilsson wrote and recorded a song, "Best Friend", which was used as the theme for a TV series, 'The Courtship of Eddie's Father'...
data.text:
Back in 1968, Harry Nilsson wrote and recorded a song, "Best Friend", which was used as the theme for a TV series, 'The Courtship of Eddie's Father' (with Bill Bixby and Brandon Cruz). At the same time, he recorded an alternate version, with different title and lyrics, called "Girlfriend".

"Girlfriend" has since been released on various Nilsson comps. "Best Friend" however, as near as I can tell, has never been released anywhere. Given the mania for bonus tracks, not to mention pure historical interest, I can't believe this hasn't been out there (officially) somewhere... Both versions are great songs, and absolutely classic Harry.

Anyone have any information about the whereabouts and status of "Best Friend'?

Thanks!

I think you are right. I've long wondered about "Best Friend", the first song of Nilsson's I ever learned from watching the show, and its total absence from the discography even today.

Two ideas:

1. Was the song originally written as "Girlfriend" and rewritten to fit the series?

2. Was "Best Friend" never more than a minute in length (as the TV show didn't require anything longer)?

I've had that CD in my collection for years, but until I read this thread, I had no idea there was a Nilsson song on it! I guess since I never watched The Courtship of Eddie's Father, I must have just skipped that track. So I've had a rare Nilsson song in my collection all this time and didn't even know it!

So I was unable to find anything on youtube only the lyrics which are obviously different then " My Best friend version" I would like to hear this version. I did not know that the Girlfriend version existed.

People let me tell about the girlfriend

She's a warm hearted woman who love me till the en
